abstracts.cdata!:
This Results Profile talks about
            supporting state-building and development in Afghanistan. In
            late 2001, after the fall of the Taliban and almost three
            decades of conflict, Afghanistan faced a daunting set of
            challenges. World Bank programs were aligned with and in
            support of the National Priority Programs, identified by the
            Afghan Government as key to the development of Afghanistan
            and the transition process. Afghanistan had made remarkable
            progress in many areas. Important development results had
            been achieved in areas such as health, education,
            microfinance, irrigation and rural livelihoods, as well as
            in public financial management. The results achieved reflect
            the massive support of the international community to help
            rebuild Afghanistan and the efforts and ingenuity of many
            enterprising Afghans who continue to deliver services in
            challenging circumstances.
